description.plain:
Diplo – born Thomas Wesley Pentz on November 10, 1978, in Tupelo, MS – is a Los Angeles-based American DJ, music producer, rapper and songwriter.

In 2004, his debut album, Florida received praise within the underground community. In 2005, Diplo founded label Mad Decent which helped introduce a multitude of sounds to clubs around the world, he worked with M.I.A., creating the Grammy-nominated track “Paper Planes” in 2007.

Since 2008 he has used the label to create the annual Mad Decent Block Parties, touring throughout the United States.
In 2009, Diplo and Switch founded the electronic dancehall band Major Lazer, Switch left in 2011 and was replaced with DJ/Producer Jillionaire and Walshy Fire.

In 2013, he formed with Skrillex a collaborative project, Jack Ü, and after multiple Grammy nominations, including Producer of the Year, he was crowned the #1 most streamed artist on Soundcloud for 2013 and he took place in the pop world after Major Lazer’s “Pon De Floor” was sampled in Beyoncé’s “Run the World.”

Since 2014, Diplo has a late-night show on BBC Radio 1/1Xtra on Sundays called “Diplo and Friends” where he curates mixes from some of the most prominent names in dance music.

In 2015, the global smash hit Major Lazer’s “Lean On”, was named Spotify’s Global Song of the Summer, making it the most successful independent song of all time. In the same year, Jack Ü’s bigger hit “Where are Ü Now” won the Grammy Award for “Best Dance Track.”

body.plain:
Diplo – born Thomas Wesley Pentz on November 10, 1978, in Tupelo, MS – is a Los Angeles-based American DJ, music producer, rapper and songwriter.

In 2004, his debut album, Florida received praise within the underground community. In 2005, Diplo founded label Mad Decent which helped introduce a multitude of sounds to clubs around the world, he worked with M.I.A., creating the Grammy-nominated track “Paper Planes” in 2007.

Since 2008 he has used the label to create the annual Mad Decent Block Parties, touring throughout the United States.
In 2009, Diplo and Switch founded the electronic dancehall band Major Lazer, Switch left in 2011 and was replaced with DJ/Producer Jillionaire and Walshy Fire.

In 2013, he formed with Skrillex a collaborative project, Jack Ü, and after multiple Grammy nominations, including Producer of the Year, he was crowned the #1 most streamed artist on Soundcloud for 2013 and he took place in the pop world after Major Lazer’s “Pon De Floor” was sampled in Beyoncé’s “Run the World.”

Since 2014, Diplo has a late-night show on BBC Radio 1/1Xtra on Sundays called “Diplo and Friends” where he curates mixes from some of the most prominent names in dance music.

In 2015, the global smash hit Major Lazer’s “Lean On”, was named Spotify’s Global Song of the Summer, making it the most successful independent song of all time. In the same year, Jack Ü’s bigger hit “Where are Ü Now” won the Grammy Award for “Best Dance Track.”

songs.full_title: Wish by Diplo (Ft. Trippie Redd)
songs.title: Wish

description.plain:
“Wish” focuses on one of Redd’s prior relationships and the emotional tolls that came with it. The melancholy production combined with emo styled lyrics draw comparisons to hits like “XO TOUR Llif3.”

This song was first premiered on Trippie Redd’s Instagram on October 18th, 2017 with the caption “Make a wish/The world is yours [Produced by: @diplo]”. The post has since been deleted. Around November 3rd, a low-quality recording was leaked of the full song, followed by a CDQ leak on February 15, 2018. Diplo confirmed the track’s full commercial release on Twitter as a part of his California EP. The official music video was released on April 25, 2018.

The mixing of the final version of the track has made the harmonizing vocals quieter in comparison with their prominence in the leak, a change which Trippie disapproved of in an Instagram story:



Trippie delivered on his promise on his August 10 album LIFE’S A TRIP which featured the original version of the song and is titled on the album as “Wish (feat. Trippie Redd) [Trippie Mix]”.

songs.embed_content: Read “Wish” by Diplo on Genius

112 ContributorsTranslationsDeutschWish Lyrics[Chorus]
Ooh, baby, what you wishin' for?
Maybe you should wish it more
Maybe the world is yours
Maybe when it rains, it pours (Keep on wishin')
I don't know how to wish anymore (Keep on wishin')
I don't know how to wish anymore, or do I?

[Post-Chorus]
Wish you'd get out my face, might go MIA
Might just blow my brain, I'd be Kurt Cobain
I can't feel my face, I can't feel my face
I can't feel my face, I can't feel my face
[Verse]
I wish you would find your chill
'Cause Lord knows this shit get real
And for this price, you know you'd kill
Man, it's big brack, you know the deal
Man, it's big slatt, you know the deal
Draco a big dragon, fire hell
Can't save me, man, save yourself
'Cause I do not need no help

[Bridge]
Keep on wishin'
Keep on wishin'
Keep on wishin'
(Ooh-oh, oh-ah)

[Chorus]
Ooh, baby, what you wishin' for?
Maybe you should wish it more
Maybe the world is yours
Maybe when it rains, it pours (Keep on wishin')
I don't know how to wish anymore (Keep on wishin')
I don't know how to wish anymore, or do I?

[Post-Chorus]
Wish you'd get out my face, might go MIA
Might just blow my brain, I'd be Kurt Cobain
I can't feel my face, I can't feel my face
I can't feel my face, I can't feel my face
You might also like[Chorus]
Ooh, baby, what you wishin' for?
Maybe you should wish it more
Maybe the world is yours
Maybe when it rains, it pours
I don't know how to wish anymore
I don't know how to wish anymore, or do I?

[Outro]
(Ooh-oh, oh-ah)76Embed

songs.full_title: Welcome to the Party by Diplo (Ft. French Montana, Lil Pump & Zhavia Ward)
songs.title: Welcome to the Party
songs.title_with_featured: Welcome to the Party (Ft. French Montana, Lil Pump & Zhavia Ward)

description.plain:
Diplo links up with French Montana and Lil Pump for their single “Welcome to the Party,“ which also features The Four finalist Zhavia Ward. The song was released as part of the soundtrack for  the film Deadpool 2.

The track was premiered by Zane Lowe on Beats 1 and was further teased on the Beats 1 Twitter:
https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/996418689573490688

songs.full_title: Revolution by Diplo (Ft. Faustix, Imanos & ​kai)
songs.title: Revolution

description.plain:
“Revolution” is an inspirational banger about overcoming adversity. The song is about let it go in life and taking chances that may not have a means to an end.

Toronto singer-songwriter Kai wrote the lyrics before she’d even met Diplo.
She told Whatever Magazine:

After being sent specific melodies to work with, I began to sing the lyrics over their production and things just clicked. ‘Revolution’ was about someone who was and is an integral part of my life. I wrote it for everyone who could relate to feeling those same dark thoughts that I experienced.

On April 1nd, 2015, Diplo announced his support for Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders. The same day, the Sanders campaign released a new ad soundtracked by “Revolution.”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwVHGbYb3c

songs.embed_content: Read “Revolution” by Diplo on Genius

The monsters in my head are scared of love
Fallen people, listen up
It's never too late to change your luck

[Pre-Chorus]

Don't let them break your stride (Eh, eh-eh, eh-eh, eh-eh)
There is light on the other side
And you'll see all the raindrops falling behind
It's a revolution, make it out tonight
It's a revolution

It's a reva, rev
